name: METX 281J
title: Mechanisms of Virulence and Resistance to Infectious Disease
description: Research seminar focusing on the mechanisms underlying host resistance or susceptibility to infectious diseases, and virulence strategies utilized by bacterial pathogens. Participants are required to present results from their own research and relevant journal articles. May be repeated for credit.

pre_req_data.text: Enrollment is restricted to graduate students. Qualified undergraduate students may enroll with instructor?s permission.
